page.title: 15Farming - Cattle and Sheep
page.content: There is no dairying here but 5 of the 10 farms run beef cow suckler herds, the other 4 summer graze and fatten store cattle. Main breed of cow is Hereford cross with Charolais and some Limousin bulls used. The immediate past chairman of the British Charolais Society, Colin Campbell, has his herd at Thrunton. The incoming Chairman of the British Limousin Society farms at Lumbylaw. These are the dominant beef breeds nationally at present. Sheep occupy slightly more land however with flocks of mule ewes, (blue-face Leicester and blackface) predominantly There are also Cheviot and scottish half-breeds. Suffolk rams are popular, Texels are used on 2 of the farms. The sheep, except at Thrunton Redhouse are largely outwintered but many farms house the cattle in winter.
